intro: Solanum rigescens var. parvibaccatum, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 cm, featuring small, ovate leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing seeds within its pulp. This species is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in woodland edges.
